questions.question_text: In a project using agile methodology, who may perform the quality control activities?

choices.C: All team members throughout the project life cycle
choices.D: Selected stakeholders at specific times during the project
choices.A: A group of quality experts at specific times during the project

discussion.content:
First Paragraph at page 300

For example, in agile projects, the Control Quality activities may be performed by all team members throughout the project life cycle. In waterfall model-based projects, the quality control activities are performed at specific times, toward the end of the project or phase, by specified team members.

Selected Answer: C
Page 276 & 300, PMBOK 6th Edition.
Not sure, 6th edition doesn't seem to say

choices.B: Total costs incurred while accomplishing work
choices.A: Budgeted work that has been completed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct
Key here 'work that has been completed' --> earned..

questions.question_text: How can a project manager represent a contingency reserve in the schedule?

choices.D: Milestones representing the completion of deliverables
choices.A: Additional weeks of work to account for unknown-unknowns risks
choices.C: Additional duration estimates in response to identified risks that have been accepted
choices.B: Task duration estimates of the best case scenarios

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct
C. Additional duration estimates in response to identified risks that have been accepted
6th edition, of 702 Glossary - contingency reserve is time or money allocated in the schedule or cost baseline for known risks with active strategies.

questions.question_text: Which action should the project manager take after the team finishes executing the scope?

choices.A: Verify the deliverables to ensure that they are correct and meet the customer's satisfaction.
choices.B: Accept all the deliverables and deliver them to the customer for final acceptance.
choices.C: Conduct a joint session with the customer, change the deliverables, and then request approval.
choices.D: Check that all change requests were implemented and release deliverables to the customer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct
Should be A, but Verify Deliverables was removed from the current edition

choices.C: Increase the probability of positive risks and eliminate all negative risks.
choices.A: Increase the probability of positive risks and decrease the probability of negative risks.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Page 395, PMBOK 6th Edition:
"The objectives of project risk management are to increase the probability and/or impact of positive risks and to decrease the possibility and/or impact of negative risks, in order to optimize the chances of project success."

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A.is the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
it must be A

It's A. From the Book Chapter 11. "The objectives of project risk management
are to increase the probability and/or impact of positive risks and to decrease the probability and/or impact of negative risks, in order to optimize the chances of project success."

C is tempting and can be correct since given this opportunity to eliminate all the negative risks project managers would do it. in other words, the ultimate goal is to eliminate risks that result in decreasing the negative risks.

Selected Answer: A
D is too specific for this question. A is correct.

Selected Answer: A
A is the one

Selected Answer: A
A seems like the more correct answer
A. Increase the probability of positive risks and decrease the probability of negative risks
A is correct-Increase the probability of positive risks, and descrease the probability of negative risks to optimize the chances of project success-Chapter 11

questions.question_text: Which are the main objectives of Project Risk Management?
